intro: Cicerbita mulgedioides, commonly known as the mulgedioides cicerbita, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky and dry environments. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads. It is often found in open habitats such as slopes and gravelly soils. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
